snippet: An appeals court ruled on Monday that Alberto Contador, a three-time winner of the Tour de France, used a performance-enhancing drug when he won the race in 2010.
abstract: Swiss appeals court rules that Spanish cyclist Alberto Contador, a three-time winner of the Tour de France, used a performance-enhancing drug when he won the race in 2010; he is being stripped of his victory in the 2010 Tour and 12 other victories since then.

byline.contributor: Raphael Minder contributed reporting from Madrid.

lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruled on Monday that Alberto Contador, a three-time winner of the Tour de France, used a performance-enhancing drug when he won the race in 2010.

headline.seo: Contador, Three-Time Tour de France Champion, Is Found Guilty of Doping
headline.main: 2010 Tour de France Winner Found Guilty of Doping
headline.print_headline: A Tour de France Winner Is Found Guilty of Doping
